snippet: Estelle Cooper, once the city administrator of Flushing Meadows-Corona Park and the head of a nonprofit group that raised money for its improvement, is under indictment.
abstract: Estelle Cooper, former city administrator of Flushing Meadows-Corona Park, is under indictment on charges she stole money from Unisphere, a nonprofit group she runs that raised money for the park's improvement; 82-year-old Cooper faces up to 15 years in prison if convicted of the theft.
lead_paragraph: Estelle Cooper, once the city administrator of Flushing Meadows-Corona Park and the head of a nonprofit group that raised money for its improvement, is under indictment.

headline.seo: Questions Linger About Estelle Cooper, Ex-Administrator of Queens Park
headline.print_headline: Park Advocate, Accused Of Theft, Leaves Questions
